Title: Object: London Hay "cookbook"
Description: Leather manuscript containing magical recipes written in Coptic. Formulary on a tall, thin opisthographic tanned leather sheet with 26 recipes for invocations of angelic powers, short iatromagical recipes, combining pharmacology with inscription of ritual signs and a multi-purpose prayer with a list of various application. The leather sheet was cut from the left flank of a calf or young bovine in line with the backbone of the animal with the top of the manuscript orientated towords the head.
Curator's comments: See bibliographic record. According to Crum EA 10376, 10122, 10414, 10434, 10391 were written by the same hand and were probably acquired by Hay at Thebes (1934, p. 51 and 195); see now O'Connell ed. 2022. Radiocarbon dates SUERC 2017: 95.4 % probability - 662 (95.4%) 775 calAD SUERC 2020: 95.4 % probability - 769 (91.4%) 898 calAD
Bibliographic references: Meyer & Smith 1994 / Ancient Christian magic: Coptic texts of ritual power (pp. 263-69 (no. 127))
O'Connell ed. 2022 / The Hay Archive of Coptic Spells on Leather: A Multidisciplinary Approach to the Materiality of Magical Practice (no. 1, pp. 79-110)
